Pharmacologic Management

Intravenous beta blockers and calcium channel blockers are equally effective in rapidly controlling the ventricular rate in acute AF in selected individuals 6
The addition of digoxin to the regimen causes a favorable outcome, however, digoxin as a single agent is generally inefficacious in slowing the ventricular rate in acute AF 6
Diltiazem may be more effective than metoprolol in achieving rapid rate control, but high-quality randomized studies are needed 7
Metoprolol had a lower failure rate than amiodarone and was superior to diltiazem in achieving rate control at 4 h 8
